entry.title: Innovating for a Circular Future: What‚Äôs new in Waste and Recycling in S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
As the world continues to place increasing emphasis on sustainability ‚Äì waste management and recycling have taken center stage in the journey towards a circular economy. At SAP, we are committed to support this shift and provide continuous innovation in our Waste and Recycling solution. In this blog, I‚Äôm excited to share some of the key innovations and features with the latest release of S/4HANA 2025 FPS0.

1. Laying the foundation with CDS Views

Core Data Services (CDS) Views have emerged as a cornerstone of modern SAP system architecture, enabling streamlined data modelling and real-time access to relevant information. In the context of SAP Waste and Recycling, CDS Views provide the foundation for efficient data management and analytics by centralizing and structuring data across various modules. This not only simplifies reporting and operational decision-making but also paves the way for more advanced capabilities, such as analytics and integrations. Some of the CDS views are also available from the previous release (2023).

  • Waste Disposal Orders

SAP waste disposal orders are core documents used in SAP S/4HANA for Waste and Recycling to manage and track the collection and transport of waste on specific planned routes. The order includes a header (route, date, start time) and line items (customer, contract, service type, address). For further information, refer - Analysis and Overview of Waste Disposal Orders

  • Weighing Documents

When vehicles carrying waste arrive at, or leave, a facility such as a landfill, incineration plant, or recycling center, they are weighed using a connected weighbridge, and these results are recorded directly in SAP S/4HANA as weighing transactions. These transactions are directly linked to waste disposal orders or contracts ensuring that the actual quantities collected, delivered, or processed are precisely documented and associated with the correct customer, contract, and order item. This ensures transparency for billing, regulatory compliance, and operational analysis. For further information, refer - Weighing Transactions ‚Äì Multi Item Weighing

  • Containers Management

Container allocation forms the central component that binds the technical equipment information (containers) with the relevant service information (waste materials, service types, frequency, start dates etc. For further information, refer Containers Tracking

  • Route Management

CDS views for Routes provide information related to different routes based on region, service types, service areas, container categories etc. You can also enable the retrieval of route identification with equipment, service number item details with its service location, interval type, and category, and resources related to the route. For further details pls refer -  Routes

  • Waste Sales Contracts

This CDS view is for the waste specific sales contracts. It provides a view of the contracts which are active and have containers allocated to their premise. For further details, refer Waste & Recycling Sales Contracts

2. Tare Based Weighing

Tare weight or vehicle weight can be maintained in the vehicle/equipment master data. Multi Item weighing transaction will automatically consider & populate the tare weight maintained in the master data to arrive at the ‚ÄúNET‚Äù weight. This eliminates the need for a second weighing of the empty vehicle to complete & post the weighing transaction thereby improving the operational efficiency. For further details, refer - Tare Weight Auto-Populate

3. Introducing Output Management and Control within Weighbridge Application

Output Management and Control in SAP S/4HANA provides a standardised framework for manging the creation, formatting and distribution of business documents such as invoices, delivery notes across different channels like print, email and electronic formats. By enabling the Weighbridge application to leverage this standard framework, we bring the same level of consistency, control and automation within waste and recycling facilities.

For further details refer - Integration with S/4 Output Management

4. Enabling Real -Time Insights with Weighing Overview Fiori App

With this release, we introduce our first analytical Fiori app providing a unified and intuitive interface to all Weighing records that allow users to monitor both internal and external weighing records. Supervisors and planners can now visualize trends, identify bottlenecks and take timely actions driving greater transparency, agility and operational excellence.

For further details refer - Weighing Overview

Want to contribute to the future roadmap?  

Join our  Continuous Influence - Waste & Recycling in S/4HANA  program today and help shape the future of Waste and Recycling in SAP S/4HANA. For more details about the program you can also refer this  blog .

entry.title: Effortless SAPUI5 Patch Management: Introducing the New SAPUI5 Runtime Repository
entry.content:
For years, the MIME repository has been the standard location for storing SAPUI5 runtime artifacts for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. In contrast, the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition retrieves SAPUI5 from the cloud CDN. Although the MIME repository has served its purpose, many customers working with SAPUI5, especially system operators installing new SAPUI5 patches, face common challenges. These include poor performance, numerous manual steps, issues with transports, and risk of inconsistent states.

The good news is that SAP introduces the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository with the release of SAP S/4HANA 2025. This modern replacement overcomes these challenges and prepares you for the next generation of SAPUI5. To ensure efficiency for all customers, downports to all maintained lower releases are available, except for SAP S/4HANA 1809 using SAPUI5 1.38. You can access this repository through SAP Notes containing transport-based correction instructions (TCIs).

Let's explore how this new repository significantly enhances your workflow.

Performance Where It Matters

  • MIME Repository: SAPUI5 patch updates can take up to 2 hours. Loading debug-sources with sap-ui-debug=true can take up to 10 minutes.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Patch upgrades are approximately 20 times faster. During runtime, loading debug sources also occurs about 20 times faster. These improvements ensure smoother operations and faster response times.

From Complexity to Simplicity

  • MIME Repository: Handles more than 70,000 individual ABAP objects. This volume poses a risk of errors and inconsistent updates.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: All runtime content is bundled into just one ABAP object. This approach guarantees consistent updates and reduces operational risks.

Automation First

  • MIME Repository: Updates rely on custom, manual procedures, which increases the maintenance effort.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Uses SAP TCI Notes and comes with an automated process specifically for SAP S/4HANA cloud operations. This makes updates easier and more reliable.

Zero Downtime Deployments

  • MIME Repository: No support for zero-downtime deployments. This limitation might cause interruptions during system upgrades.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Fully supports online deployment with zero downtime. This feature ensures that SAPUI5 content remains continuously available, even during system upgrades.

Safe, Standardized Rollbacks

  • MIME Repository: Reverting patches can be error-prone, often requiring manual fixes and risking inconsistent system states.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Reverting SAPUI5 patches is fully supported. Runtime content is delivered as a single ABAP object, and the update process integrates with TCIs. Rollbacks are straightforward, consistent, and safe. This approach simplifies the validation of new patches: if issues arise, you can reliably revert to the previous stable state without lengthy manual intervention or risking inconsistencies across systems.

Future-Proof 

  • MIME Repository: Not compatible with multiple SAPUI5 versions.
  • SAPUI5 Runtime Repository: Supports multiple SAPUI5 versions in parallel, making it ready for the future while ensuring backward compatibility.

Here's an overview of all the improvements:

Why This Matters

The move from MIME Repository to the new SAPUI5 Runtime Repository isn‚Äôt just a technical upgrade ‚Äî it‚Äôs a significant step toward:

  • Faster and safer patch updates.
  • Reduced operational effort.
  • Continuous availability.
  • Future compatibility.

If your organization uses on-premise landscapes and works with SAPUI5, it's time to embrace this change: the SAPUI5 Runtime Repository becomes automatically available with the current SAP S/4HANA 2025 release and in the latest support packages of all maintained SAP S/4HANA versions except SAP S/4HANA 1809.

Even if you do not want to upgrade to a new support package, you can still use the SAPUI5 runtime repository by installing SAP Note 3599156. If you have hesitated to install a new SAPUI5 patch, now is the time to try the new procedure and benefit from its efficacy and ease. Installing the latest SAPUI5 patches ensures your applications run efficiently today and are prepared for the future.

üëâHave you performed any SAPUI5 patch upgrades recently? What has your experience been like so far? To get started, refer to SAP Note 3599156.

entry.title: SAP numbering again ‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs jump!
entry.content:
It‚Äôs been a while, and I thought I was grown out of this, but I can‚Äôt get out of the habit.
I wonder why software component SAP BASIS has jumped up to version 8.16 recently.

Reminds me of my old blog posts on SAP numbering:

  • Why SAP ERP 6.0 EHP6 contains SAP BASIS 7.31 - SAP Community
  • SAP versioning, part 2 (why EHP7 contains SAP APPL... - SAP Community

Product version SAP S/4HANA 2025 (in short: 2025) is available since October 2025, and it contains software component version SAP BASIS 8.16. I must have been inattentive for a moment, since I was still considering it in the number range ‚Äú7-something‚Äù. OK, kids grow up and get older, but S/4HANA 2023 was based on 7.58 ‚Äì now it is on 8.16. This is a jump, isn‚Äôt it?

Subtracting 16 from 58 provides an interesting but misleading answer. Of course, you already see the real reason: my inattentive phase took too long, the distance between 2023 and 2025 is longer than before. SAP S/4HANA (Cloud Private Edition and on-prem) switched from a yearly to a bi-yearly release cycle, with three Feature Package Stacks in-between. But SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is delivered every quarter, and with this, it is eating up the numbers for the SAP BASIS versions.
As this is sorted out, let us look onto another component: the kernel. SAP Kernel 9.16 is used for 2025. Not a typo: SAP Kernel 9.16 and SAP Basis 8.16. 2023 uses SAP Kernel 7.93, and a move from 7.93 to 9.16 is even a bigger jump than the one SAP BASIS did!

Again, my inattention was probably the reason for my astonishment: I ignored SAP Business ByDesign (in short: ByD), another ABAP-based business solution from SAP that uses SAP Kernel and SAP BASIS. ByD has eaten up the kernel numbers in the 8-range, so 2025 jumped to ‚Äú9-something‚Äù. Jump 2 is clarified.

Let‚Äôs see what comes next to challenge my numbering skills.

entry.title: SAP Screen Personas in the Default Installation Stack of SAP S/4HANA 2025, Private Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Implications for Greenfield Installations

For new SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition customers, this change ensures a simplified and accelerated setup experience.

With SAP Screen Personas pre-installed:

  • Customers gain immediate access to screen personalization and simplification capabilities.

  • The installation and configuration process is significantly simplified, reducing both time and effort.

This enhancement underscores SAP‚Äôs commitment to delivering a seamless and user-centric onboarding experience for S/4HANA customers.

Impact on Existing Installations

For existing SAP Screen Personas customers, the transition to SAP S/4HANA 2025 is expected to be smooth and non-disruptive.

  • If the currently installed SAP Screen Personas add-on version is compatible with SAP S/4HANA 2025, it can be retained and used without modification.

  • If the existing version is not compatible, a manual upgrade of the add-on must be completed prior to installing SAP S/4HANA 2025.

Future FPS Upgrades

When a new Feature Pack Stack (FPS) becomes available for SAP S/4HANA 2025, Private Cloud Edition, it will include the latest available Support Package (SP) of SAP Screen Personas at that time.

Support Package Release Strategy or SAP Screen Personas.

There is no change to the existing Support Package (SP) release strategy for SAP Screen Personas.

  • SAP will continue to deliver annual Support Package releases , providing regular enhancements and maintenance updates.
  • Customers may choose to upgrade to newer Support Packages as they become available.

This continuity ensures customers can plan their upgrades in alignment with their broader S/4HANA lifecycle strategy. Please refer to note 2013453 for more details.

Summary

With SAP Screen Personas now included as part of the default SAP S/4HANA 2025, Private Cloud Edition installation stack, customers benefit from an even more integrated and efficient user experience.

This change eliminates the need for separate installation steps and reinforces SAP‚Äôs ongoing focus on delivering streamlined, intuitive, and adaptable user experiences within the S/4HANA environment.

Further Reading:
  • SAP Screen Personas
  • Getting Started with UI Adaptations for Classic Applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Learn more about SAP Screen Personas:

  • Online training. The best way to learn the basics about SAP Screen Personas (Adapt UI for classic applications) is to take our free training course on the learning.sap.com platform: https://learning.sap.com/courses/adapting-the-ui-in-sap-s-4hana-cloud-using-sap-screen-personas
  • Connect with your peers. Every other month, we have a group of customers that gather online to share best practices, demo their flavors, and answer each other‚Äôs questions. Experts from the product team also join to explain how to use the latest functionality. If you are interested in joining, you can sign up online to join the SAP Screen Personas practitioner forum. This will add you to the mailing list for the monthly meeting summaries. Please contact ‚ÄúPeter Spielvogel‚Äú or me directly if you want to join the monthly calls.
  • Product documentation. The SAP Screen Personas documentation, recently updated to be even more clear and comprehensive, contains the latest information about the product.

Going forward with SAP Screen Personas

If you are not currently using SAP Screen Personas, why not?

Worried that we won‚Äôt support it into the future? Don‚Äôt be.  We are supporting SAP Screen Personas functionality through at least 2040.

Have other concerns about the roadmap for SAP Screen Personas? See if we answer them in our latest roadmap blog post.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Release 2022 & Higher Release (HCM)
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Human Capital Management - Solution Strategy

 

As SAP SuccessFactors remains the primary focus of SAP‚Äôs HCM innovation, there are no plans for major additional functionalities or re-architectures in S/4HANA. HCM in S/4HANA is intended as a bridge to give customers additional time to move to SAP SuccessFactors. Consistency with the Business Suite is ensured by applying the same data model.

Therefore, no new or updated business processes are developed here. Some Fiori apps will be provided over time, including analytical pages ‚Äì check out the Fiori Apps Library and filter for Product Suite SAP S/4HANA and the LoB ‚ÄúHuman Resources‚Äù.

Investments into intelligent scenarios are entirely focused on SuccessFactors, which is one of the frontrunners for Generative AI ‚Äì more details here: Generative AI with SAP

The HCM functionality in S/4HANA is licensed - both in private cloud and on-premise - via engine licenses with an ‚Äúemployee‚Äù metric, no longer by core named user licenses. SAP thus paves the way also commercially for the transition to SuccessFactors, where the same commercial model applies

Business Function for SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA (H4S4_1)

  • HCM in S/4HANA (Business function H4S4_1) is available in S/4HANA starting from release 2022
  • All HCM customers with S/4HANA Release 2022 or 2023 must activate H4S4_1 business function (docu) in transaction SFW5

‚ÄìA system S/4HANA Release 2022 or 2023  without H4S4_1 business function activation runs as an HCM S/4HANA Compatibility Pack

  • Pay attention: H4S4_1 business function activation is irreversible. It deprecates some HCM (PA, TM & PY) functionalities normally applied in on-premise edition (SAP ERP HCM, HCM S/4HANA Compatibility Pack), so the activation must be object of a Conversion/Upgrade Project to evaluate impact of used deprecated functionalities and implement suggested alternative solutions
    • SAP Note 3091160 - SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì General Approach and Strategy - SAP for Me contains the lists of deprecated functionalities and suggest alternative solutions to apply
    • Readiness Check run gives informations about deprecated functionalities
  • This business function is exclusively available to customers who have purchased a separate license to use SAP Human Capital Management for SAP S/4HANA
  • With the release of S/4HANA 2025 and higher, this business function will be activated by default. Therefore, the new functionality for HCM for S/4HANA is available for all HCM customers.
  • Using the so-called HR mini-master in an SAP S/4HANA system, only to define business partner in the "Employee" role in a non-HCM system, does not require licensing SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA, even if the Business Function H4S4_1 is active. Please refer to SAP Note 3369920.

entry.title: ASUG Tech Connect 2025 summary: vibe coding, UX innovation, and AI everywhere
entry.content:
ASUG Tech Connect 2025 in Louisville, Kentucky, delivered big on both technology and connection. From the opening keynote to the final session, there were many examples of how AI improves both developer and business user productivity. While all the generative AI technologies are revolutionary and potentially very disruptive to organizations that ignore their impact, it was great to see AI applied in a variety of ways from creating ABAP code to moving Z-transactions in a clean core methodology. In this post, I‚Äôll highlight a few important themes, along with several moments at ASUG Tech Connect that made an impact on me. In each section, I‚Äôll provide some questions for you to discuss with your team.

ABAP is still going strong

The session ‚ÄúExtensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP‚Äù says it all. Jens and Raghavendra  showed that ABAP has new generative AI tools that you can use to extend standard SAP Fiori apps and build new custom apps. With so many customers still contemplating their journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the ability to use familiar skills makes it easier to transition.

AI-powered features make SAP Cloud ERP even easier to use

In ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs Next: AI-First Innovations in SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite‚Äù, Ullas and I showed several new embedded features to boost business users‚Äô productivity, most of which were powered by AI. Demos included a mix of released functionality, features in beta, and even a sneak preview of something from our lab. We received lots of great feedback on how people plan to use smart helpers if we bring this to market.

My Home for SAP S/4HANA

SAP Fiori elements apps

  • AI-assisted enterprise search
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for insights cards
  • AI-assisted smart solutions for situations in My Home
  • Recap
  • Joule
  • AI-assisted easy filter
  • AI-assisted smart summarization
  • AI-assisted easy fill
  • AI-assisted error explanation
  • Smart Helpers (working name ‚Äì sneak preview)

Ask yourself:

  • Do your business users still spend too much time on manual navigation?
  • Could a smart home screen or conversational interface drastically reduce that?
  • What is holding you back from adopting AI in your organization?

No-code, low-code, and pro-code are converging with vibe coding

In ‚ÄúUsing Generative AI to Accelerate SAP Fiori App Development‚Äù Ullas demonstrated how code-generation, conversational interfaces, and tooling changes are altering how we build apps. Using VS Code and Cline, connected to an SAP back end, he created a fully functional app, including CAP service and sample data, using only text prompts ‚Äì no coding at all. He started the app creation process by loading an image of what he wanted, then added functionality by asking Cline to build it. When error messages came up, he pasted screen shots back into the tool and asked it to fix the error. This can reduce the time to create a first prototype from weeks to hours. Skilled developers are required for making sure the app is production worthy, testing, and putting into production. We had some customers share their experience using coding agents and appreciation for how SAP packaged this to simplify the process. Some plan to expand their efforts on this journey and potentially share their stories in next year‚Äôs ASUG Tech Connect or SAP TechEd.

Ask yourself:

  • How much more AI can you use to accelerate development?
  • What would you need to see to gain confidence that you can use it for building apps?
  • Can you rebuild some of your old customizations in a clean core way to make your IT environment more agile?

SAP Fiori is essential to capture the full value of your SAP Cloud ERP implementation

My session on ‚ÄúCreating better user experiences with AI-powered SAP Fiori apps‚Äù discussed how SAP Fiori is a critical part of generating value from using SAP S/4HANA. Most of the audience had some Fiori experience and most were using AI in some capacity in their organization.

 

The session started with the origins of Fiori and highlighted the huge leap in usability from the old SAP GUI screens to the intuitive, agile, and intelligent UX that My Home and SAP Fiori apps provide. It included a demo of many of the UX innovations in SAP Cloud ERP today, and discussion of how to get started with Fiori in your organization.

View slides from ‚ÄúCreating better user experiences with AI-powered SAP Fiori apps‚Äù session.

The main message was to get started now on your UX transformation to provide your employees with a better user experience and access to AI-assisted capabilities that are built int SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Ask yourself:

  • What is holding us back from using more Fiori in the organization? Is it resistance from the users themselves, IT, or the business owners?
  • How do we quantify the business value of SAP Fiori in terms of higher user productivity, better data quality, lower training costs, and reduced cost of making changes to screens?

Clean core is necessary for digital transformation

The topic of clean core, meaning minimizing customizations to the SAP S/4HANA environment, was reinforced everywhere. The hands-on sessions ‚ÄúBuild On-Stack Extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP‚Äù and ‚ÄúModernize Classic Extensions for Clean Core‚Äù emphasized how you can use clean core principles and still build customizations to fit your business‚Äôs unique needs. Andre, Nora, and Ullas explained how to do this and guided people through practical exercises.

Ask yourself:

  • How much customization do you need to run your business? (Less is more!)
  • Can you use standard apps for more processes than you are doing today?
  • What is the cost of maintaining your custom code and how much is custom code preventing you from adopting the latest SAP ERP versions?

You don‚Äôt have to move to SAP Cloud ERP on your own

With such a broad collection of industries represented at ASUG Tech Connect, it was easy to find someone who had already solved the challenges you are facing. That‚Äôs the whole point of attending a large networking event like this ‚Äì to connect with like-minded individuals who want to move forward and need a little help (or push). I was fortunate to have many interesting breakfast, lunch, and break conversations about where people are struggling with moving their users to SAP Fiori apps.

The colleagues from Naturipe Farms, Brian and Dario, shared some of their experiences in ‚ÄúCustomer Show and Tell: From CDS View to Fiori Launchpad: Full-Stack Development with Eclipse ADT with Naturipe.‚Äù It was the third year in a row that they are presenting, so it‚Äôs great to follow their progress. Next year they plan to share their progress with a vibe-coding approach.

Ask yourself:

  • What communities can you join to learn from peers? ASUG, SAP Fiori development roundtable?
  • What thought leaders do you follow on LinkedIn that you can learn from?

There is no technology change without people change

It‚Äôs always the ‚Äúsoft skills‚Äù sessions that surprise me at SAP events with the lasting impact they make. Perhaps this is because the fundamental principles don‚Äôt change from year to year with new technology innovations, so they generally have more staying power. The panel on ‚ÄúLeading change in the age of AI: driving digital transformation through emotionally intelligent communication‚Äù had many great insights for business and technology leaders who are steering their organizations through the massive changes that an SAP S/4HANA upgrade, SAP Fiori implementation, or AI adoption brings. Some key takeaways included: focusing on business outcomes and ensuring that people can grow from the changes.

Ask yourself:

  • How can I empower my people by asking them: What are you good at? What do you want? What do you need? What do you fear? This will help you preempt many objections that are rooted in these issues.
  • What happens to my organization if we do nothing?

Get comfortable being uncomfortable

This is a time of rapid change for enterprise software and business in general. The AI tools have frequent updates in which their capabilities improve in some areas and don‚Äôt in others. It‚Äôs hard to keep up with all this, but critical. Nvidia CEO, Jensen Huang says ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not going to lose your job to AI. You‚Äôre going to lose your job to someone who uses AI.‚Äù Change is a part of progress; get used to it.

Ask yourself:

  • What new AI-related skills have you learned in the next month?
  • Where can you try some AI in your business that will allow you to learn with low risk?

Next steps:

  • Review the slides, which are available to attendees on the ASUG Tech Connect website.
  • Start exploring AI tools for development now. Even if you are not ready to incorporate them into your core business processes, you need to gain experience using them if you want to stay relevant in the industry.
  • Identify two use cases where AI can make a measurable business impact. Build a proof of concept in your test environment or sandbox system to measure the return on investment.
  • Follow the speakers of sessions that you liked on LinkedIn. You will gain insights into what they are working on and likely see innovations as soon as they become available.
  • Subscribe to our SAP Fiori development newsletter, where we will share new innovations for application development as soon as they are available.

entry.title: Financial Execution & Claims for Trade Promotions with SAP Revenue Growth Management & SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
1. Bridging the Gap Between Promotion Planning and Financial Accuracy 

Imagine you are a Key Account Manager (KAM) at a leading beverage manufacturer working with a large retail chain. You design various trade promotions (e.g., discounts, displays, rebates) to boost sales and market presence.  

Yet, managing associated trade spends, reconciling retailer claims, and ensuring precise financial settlements can be an operational headache for finance controllers, who play a critical role in overseeing and validating all financial postings related to trade spend, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and accountability throughout the process. Supporting this effort is the Order-to-Cash (O2C) specialist, responsible for managing the end-to-end order process, including order fulfillment, invoicing, and handling claims or disputes related to trade promotions. 

Manual reconciliation, delayed financial clarity, and disconnected systems often hinder teams from accurately measuring promotion effectiveness and revenue impact, ultimately slowing the growth that KAMs and consumer packaged goods (CPG) companies depend on. 

This is where our solution steps in, with its Financial Execution and Claims capabilities that seamlessly bridge trade promotion planning and financial execution with the SAP S/4HANA ecosystem. By connecting promotions planned in SAP Revenue Growth Management directly to financial execution in S/4HANA and then to claims management, we offer a fully automated end-to-end solution for financial posting. 

 

2. A Suite Designed to Integrate and Simplify Trade Spend Execution: SAP Revenue Growth Management 

SAP Revenue Growth Management (REVENUE GROWTH MANAGEMENT) serves as a central platform enabling CPG companies to create, plan, and monitor promotions with built-in integration into SAP S/4HANA‚Äôs finance and sales modules. Trade promotion tactics such as discounts, rebates, and display funding are transformed into condition contracts and condition records for pricing within SAP S/4HANA, becoming the foundation for financial execution. 

The execution phase uses these contracts and condition records for pricing during invoicing, ensuring promotions reflect correctly in accounting. Following execution, claims are submitted by retailers for reimbursements or deductions in many different forms and methods. Once these documents and back-up materials are obtained, the claims are matched against the condition contracts. Approved claims trigger settlements, creating credit memos or adjustments that close the loop for accurate revenue recognition.  

This end-to-end integration reduces manual work, prevents errors like overpayments, and offers finance teams full visibility into promotional trade spend obligations. It also empowers KAMs to achieve measurable revenue growth‚Äîall operating out-of-the-box within the SAP Business Suite. 

Target integration landscape for financial execution and settlement of trade promotions  

For more information on our current capabilities, see An Overview of SAP Revenue Growth Management. 

 

3. Key Functionalities of Financial Execution and Claims in SAP Revenue Growth Management 

3.1. Variable Discounts Explained   

Variable discounts, also known as OI discounts (can be called either on-invoice or off-invoice depending on the region), are discounts directly applied to the invoice. They happen only during the sell-in process. 

  • Effective Pricing Strategy Enablement

Variable discounts provide KAMs with the agility to implement pricing tactics such as a percentage off the list price or fixed amounts directly on sales invoices. This capability supports strategic selling, such as volume discounts or targeted discounts (e.g., for specific channels, customers, or timing), driving retailer engagement without cumbersome manual interventions.  

  • Direct Invoice Application

Since variable discounts apply at invoice generation (sell-in phase), financial postings are immediate and precise. This direct connection between promotions and invoicing simplifies reconciliation and reduces disputes from the start. 

The precision enabled by variable discounts not only ensures timely and precise financial postings but also guarantees that retailers receive precise invoices, leading to improved retailer satisfaction and stronger business partnerships. 

Trade spend scenarios

3.2. Comprehensive Variable and Fixed Rebates Management  

  • Accrual-Based Rebate Handling

SAP Revenue Growth Management allows setting aside accruals for both variable and fixed rebates. This ensures liabilities are reserved accurately in financial accounts, streamlining budget control.  

  • Variable rebates, also known as bill backs or retroactive rebates in the US, are rebates that vary based on sales or shipment volumes. Variable rebates can apply to all segments of the distribution chain, including sell-in, sell-through, and sell-out. 
  • Fixed rebates, also known as lump sums, such as display fees or feature costs, do not depend on product movements within the distribution chain but remain constant over a promotional period. 

 

  • Support for Rebate Payment Processes

SAP Revenue Growth Management facilitates various payment methods, such as credit memos against accounts receivable, and plans to support accounts payable processes for retailer invoice claims in 2026. This versatility aligns with varying corporate accounting practices and enhances transparency and efficiency in managing trade spend. 

Proper accrual management ensures rebate liabilities are consistently and correctly recognized in financial accounts, enabling compliant and timely accounting postings. This approach builds confidence and efficiency within finance teams, supports KAMs by providing transparent visibility into trade spend, and facilitates appropriate sales revenue recognition. 

 

3.3. End-to-End Claims Management and Settlement 

  • Unified Claim Request Management

All trade-related claims from retailers ‚Äî whether deduction claims due to short pays or invoice claims requesting reimbursement ‚Äî are consolidated within RGM Claims Management. This provides a single source of truth with full visibility into claims status, approval workflows, and linkage to financial postings and settlements. 

  • Validation and Workflow

The system supports claim matching to corresponding promotions, with validation rules that reduce manual errors and allow multiple analysts to perform different validations in parallel, enhancing operational efficiency in complex accounts. 

  • Settlement and Financial Transparency (planned for 2026)

Settlement functionality, integrated with SAP S/4HANA condition contracts, will automate the creation of settlement and accounting documents, ensuring accurate financial execution. This upcoming capability will enhance audit compliance and provide clearer visibility into trade spend. 

Ultimately, these capabilities help KAMs and CPG companies deliver smoother processes and have more satisfied retail customers. 

 

4. Co-Innovation: Advancing Financial Execution and Claims Management 

With the Financial Execution and Claims capabilities of SAP Revenue Growth Management, CPG companies benefit from an integrated, fully automated end-to-end financial posting process that links key functions such as variable discounts, variable and fixed rebate management, and unified claims handling.  

This seamless integration facilitates timely financial postings and enhances visibility into trade spending, empowering finance controllers and KAMs throughout the trade promotion lifecycle.  

If you're a finance controller, O2C specialist, or a KAM eager to innovate how promotions translate into accurate financial outcomes and tangible business results, contact us today at RGM_Engage@sap.com to join our co-innovation program. Together, let's shape financial execution and claims with SAP Revenue Growth Management. 

 

More Information

Documentation on SAP Help Portal

Topic Page for SAP Revenue Growth Management

    • Introducing Calendar View in SAP Revenue Growth Management: A Visual Leap for Strategic Planning
    • Decoding Promotional Success: Embedded Analytics in SAP Revenue Growth Management
    • Unlocking Trade Spend Control Efficiency with Funds Management in SAP Revenue Growth Management
    • Consolidating Customer Planning: Unleash Growth with SAP Revenue Growth Management‚Äôs Account Plan
    • Elevate Your Promotion Strategy: Baseline Management with SAP Revenue Growth Management 
    • Driving Promotion Excellence: Streamlined Creation and Copying with SAP Revenue Growth Management
    • Financial Execution & Claims for Trade Promotions with SAP Revenue Growth Management & SAP Cloud ERP

entry.title: What's new for Production Planning in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2025
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud has been officially released, and many new feature were delivered for production planning. From UI improvements to the MRP Cockpit Fiori apps to new Business Add-Ins available for MRP and production orders, this blog provides an overview of those new features that are available in the latest SAP S/4HANA release.

Improvements for MRP Cockpit Fiori Apps

Several improvements were delivered for the MRP Cockpit Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage - Net Segments (F0247A), Monitor Material Coverage - Net and Individual Segments (F2101A) and Manage Material Coverage (F0251A), bringing additional functionalities that util now were only available in the Stock/Requirements List, and also innovations that will mimic features originally available in the MRP List. 

Rescheduling and Cancelling of Proposals

Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage - Net Segments (F0247A) and Monitor Material Coverage - Net and Individual Segments (F2101A) were enhanced to display information about the number of rescheduling proposals that were generated for a specific material.

These apps will now display of the number of rescheduling proposals, and new filters were also introduced to allow users to filter for materials with specific rescheduling messages. The following figure shows the new fields and the new filters in the app Monitor Material Coverage.


Figure 1: Rescheduling Proposals in Monitor Material Coverage

Fiori app Manage Material Coverage has been also enhanced with new actions that will help users to resolve coverage issues and make sure requirements can be met as planned:

  • Proposals to reschedule MRP elements to an earlier date (reschedule in)
  • Proposals to reschedule MRP elements to a later date (reschedule out)
  • Proposals to cancel MRP elements (cancel process)

The following figure shows and example of the action Reschedule Out, for a purchase order with a rescheduling message:


Figure 2: Rescheduling actions in Manage Material Coverage

 

Last MRP Run

Fiori Apps Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage were also enhanced to show the date of the last MRP Run, and to allow users to filter for material segments using the date of the Last MRP Run. The following figures show the filter and the field in Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage.


Figure 3: Last MRP Run in Monitor Material Coverage

 

Figure 4: Last MRP Run in Manage Material Coverage

 

Planning Time Fence and Manual Firming Date

Another enhancement to the Monitor Material Coverage and Manage Material Coverage Fiori apps was the introduction of the Planning Time Fence and the possibility to set or change a Manual Time Fence.

New filters and columns for MRP type and planning time fence were added into the Material Coverage app, as we can see in the Figure below.


Figure 5: Planning Time Fence and MRP Type in Monitor Material Coverage

 

As we can see in Figure 6, Fiori App Manage Material Coverage now can show the Planning Time Fence, and users will also have the possibility to edit the Planning Time Fence.  

Figure 6: Planning Time Fence in Manage Material Coverage


Accept MRP Run Result

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also introduced a new feature called Accept the MRP results, allowing the planner to mark materials for which the MRP result has been already evaluated.

A new filter has been already introduced in Fiori App Monitor Material Coverage, so that the planner can filter for material segments where the MRP result has been already accepted or not, and there is also a new column called MRP Result Accepted, as we can see in Figure 7.

Figure 7: MRP Result Accepted in Fiori App Monitor Material Coverage

 

Fiori app Manage Material Coverage has also been enhanced with a button that allows the planner to Accept the MRP Results, or revoke the Acceptance of MRP results, as shown in Figure 8.  

Figure 8: Button Accept MRP Result in Fiori App Manage Material Coverage

 

This feature has been also introduced in both collect and individual access of the Stock/Requirements List (transactions MD04 and MD07), as I described in my blog Accept/Revoke MRP Run results in the Stock/Requirements List and MRP Fiori Apps, and it is available for earlier releases, as described in the blog. However, only as of SAP S/4HANA 2025 users will have the ability to mass Accept and Revoke the MRP Results from the Collective Access of the Stock/Requirements List, as shown in Figure 9.


Figure 9: Mass acceptance of MRP results in the Stock/Requirements List.

 

Downporting new features to SAP S/4HANA 2023

Some of the new features listed above can be also introduce in SAP S/4HANA 2023 with the implementation of the following notes:

No.

SAP Note

Description

1

3586336

SAP- Production Planning- Supporting Features- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run.

2

3592002

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Monitor material coverage- Net & Individual segments Fiori Application ( F2101A )

3

3592003

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Monitor material coverage- Net segments ( F0247A )

4

3591572

SAP- Production Planning- Rescheduling Proposals, Planning time fence and Last MRP Run in Manage material coverage Fiori Application (F0251A)

 

MRP Live 

Technical improvements were also delivered for MRP Live in SAP S/4HANA 2025, including new BAdIs and the improvements in the integration of documents with PP/DS and IBP.

Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

SAP S/4HANA introduced a new feature in MRP Live, that allows the creation of business transaction events (BTEs) for business documents created within MRP Live (e.g. planned orders, purchase requisitions, scheduling agreements and stock transfer requisitions) enabling post-processing steps for other applications like PP/DS, IBP.

In previous releases, materials for which documents had to be integrated to PP/DS or IBP had to be planned by MRP Live in ABAP instead of HANA, because documents generated or changed by MRP were integrated by means of an RFC. With the new integration using BTE events, those materials can be planned in HANA, which an improved MRP Live performance.

For example, if we activate Advanced Planning for a material, and we choose the option PP/DS Display Only for the scope limitation, this material would be planned in ABAP by MRP Live. As of SAP S/4HANA 2025, we can use BTE events to integrate those documents, allowing the material to be planned in HANA.

The setting to activate the integration with BTE can be found in transaction PPHMRPSET, as we can see in Figure 10.


Figure 10: Setting to activate Business Transaction Events in MRP Live.

New BAdIs for MRP

  • Adjustment of Planned Order Component Data during BOM Explosion (PPH_PLDORD_COMP_ADJ):  This new BAdI allows you to modify the storage location and production supply area of components in planned orders during BOM explosion in the following processes:

    • Planning run of material requirements planning and master production scheduling

    • Manual planned order creation
    • Backflush for repetitive manufacturing without planned order

  • Additional Parameters for Navigation Profile (MD_NAVIGATION_ADJUSTüòû With this new BAdI you can change the parameter IDs for transactions which are maintained in Customizing activity Define Navigation Profiles. Navigation profiles enable you to navigate faster and more flexibly between transactions, and with the new BAdI you can use more than only three parameter IDs.

 

Shop-Floor Control

Besides the already mentioned improvements for MRP, SAP S/4HANA 2025 also brought improvements for Shop-Floor Control, including a better handling for partial consumption posted from EWM, and new technical objects, like RAP Business Objects and Data Products. 

 

Partial Consumption and Split for Error Handling for Automatic Goods Movement, COGI

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also introduced a new feature that enables partial retrograde goods issue for non-batched and non-serialized components in embedded SAP Extended Warehouse Management, checking availability in the bin of the production supply area during the manufacturing process

This feature allows postprocessing of error records from automatic goods movements (COGI transaction) only for unavailable quantities of components, and it works for discrete and repetitive manufacturing. It will enable as-is partial goods movement between SAP EWM and production during synchronous goods movement processes, increasing PSA stock control, reducing clerical work, and improving accuracy of stock data. Figure 11 shows the setting use to activate this new feature in the Production Scheduling Profile.


Figure 11: Goods Issue Quantity Split setting in the Production Scheduling Profile

 

Example:

  • 3 EA of component KOMPK1-01 are available in the bin in production supply area, as shown in Figure 12.


Figure 12: 3 EA of component available in the Supply Area.

 

  • Figure 13 shows that the backflush of the component for a production order requires 12 EA,


Figure 13: Backflush requires 12 EA of the component.

 

  • When we post the backflush for the production order, 3 EA of component KOMPK1-01 are issued, as shown in Figure 14.


Figure 14: Backflush was posted and the consumption of 3 EA has been posted.

 

  • As we have activated the Goods Issue Quantity Split in the Production Scheduling Profile, the remaining quantity of 9 EA went into Postprocessing of Error Records from Automatic Goods Movements (transaction COGI), as shown in Figure 15.

 


Figure 15: Postprocessing of the remaining quantity in COGI

 

BAdI for Initialization of Order Component on Creation

With the new Business Add-In (BAdI), Order Component - Initialization on Creation (PPH_PRODORD_COMP_ADJ) you can fill the material planning relevance and the bulk indicator at the order component (reservation) level when creating an order.

 

RAP Business Objects for Production Orders

SAP S/4HANA 2025 also brought new technical objects that will help customers to make sure that custom developments are clean core compatible. New RAP Business Objects were introduced for Production Orders, Process Orders and Routings, enabling cloud-native APIs for SAP BusinessObjects in production execution and on-stack extensibility for Manufacturing.



Figure 16: New Production and Process Order RAP BOs 

 

Manufacturing Data Products

A SAP data product is a pre-packaged dataset that is ready for consumption by applications for analytics, AI, and other business intelligence purposes. A comprehensive set of ERP data products sourced from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now available, providing structured insights into manufacturing execution:

  • Production version
  • Work center
  • Manufacturing codes
  • Production confirmation
  • Production order
  • Enterprise resource capacity
  • Production routing]

SAP API Hub provides more information about the Manufacturing Data Products.

 

See also:

Planning Time Fence and Last MRP Run

Accept Planning Result of MRP Run

Rescheduling Proposals for MRP Elements

Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

BAdI for Adjustment of Planned Order Component Data during BOM Explosion

BAdI for Allowing Additional Parameters for Navigation Profile

BAdI for Initialization of Order Component on Creation

Partial Goods Issue for Component Consumption in Manufacturing

API Hub

 

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Regional Implementation Group
